metadata.title: CVE-2021-30547 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Out of bounds write in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.101allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform out of bounds memoryaccess via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
